thread.title: Chocolate Malt Shoppe Pie
thread.title_full: Chocolate Malt Shoppe Pie Recipe | Taste of Home

author: tasteofhome.com
title: Chocolate Malt Shoppe Pie
text: I especially like serving this dessert at a cookout or at any event where there are children—it's always a big hit! —Beth Wanek, Little Chute, Wisconsin Quick Contest Winning Prep: 20 min. + freezing MAKES: 6-8 servings Quick Contest Winning Prep: 20 min. + freezing MAKES: 6-8 1-1/2 cups chocolate wafer crumbs 1/4 cup butter, melted 1 pint vanilla ice cream, softened 1/2 cup crushed malted milk balls 2 tablespoons milk, divided 3 tablespoons chocolate malted milk powder 3 tablespoons marshmallow creme 1 cup heavy whipping cream Additional heavy whipping cream, whipped, optional Additional malted milk balls, optional 1 piece: 410 calories, 27g fat (16g saturated fat), 74mg cholesterol, 286mg sodium, 40g carbohydrate (18g sugars, 1g fiber), 5g Combine wafer crumbs and butter; press into an ungreased 9-in. pie pan. Freeze until set. Combine the ice cream, crushed malted milk balls and 1 tablespoon milk; spoon into crust. Freeze for 1 hour. In a large bowl, combine the malted milk powder, marshmallow creme and remaining milk. Add cream; whip until soft peaks form. Spread over ice cream layer. Freeze for several hours or overnight. Just before serving, garnish each serving with additional whipped cream and malted milk balls if desired. Yield: 6-8 servings.
